newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Daily Variety - Sept 4.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Daily Variety - Sept 4.

text.p: Matt Damon has landed the lead lawyer role in "The Rainmaker," the Francis Ford Coppola-directed adaptation of the John Grisham bestseller, Daily Variety reported on Wednesday.,
Damon, who was last seen in "Courage Under Fire," will play Rudy Baylor, a young lawyer who finds that the job he worked so hard to land has disappeared along with the firm.

* Jack Lemmon is one of the five Kennedy Center honorees this year at a Dec 8 ceremony, as are playwright Edward Albee, composer-musician Benny Carter, country's Johnny Cash and dancer Maria Tallchief.

* A TV movie based on the America's Most Wanted franchise, a pop-culture quiz show for Generation Xer's, and a special about aliens and monsters in Hollywood are part of Twentieth Television's beefed-up development and production slate for 1997.
* Producer Robert Altman and director Alan Rudolph, who last collaborated on 1994's "Mrs. Parker and the Vicious Circle," will reteam to make "Afterglow."
The film stars Nick Nolte, Julie Christie, Lara Flynn Boyle and Johnny Lee Miller. It begins shooting in Montreal Saturday.
Written by Rudolph, the film follows two couples, one in their late 40s, the other in their 20s, whose troubled marriages become entwined.
* The summer 1996 moviegoing season closed with a record $2.19 billion -- a boost of about three percent from the prior seasonal high set last year.

It's also the second straight year in which there was modest box office growth but a decline in admissions. The season recorded roughly 488.6 million torn stubs, a dip of about 0.5 percent in ticket sales.

* Marc Platt, former TriStar Pictures president, has joined Seagram Co's Universal Pictures as president of production. Platt replaces Hal Lieberman, who exited the studio two weeks ago after nine years.
